alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 3:21AM PST until March 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches with up to 1 foot in higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Curry County and Josephine County-Kalmiopsis Wilderness, Eastern Douglas County Foothills and northern Jackson County. This includes the communities of Toketee Falls, Butte Falls and Prospect and portions of Highway 62, Highway 227 and Highway 138. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult and could impact the morning commute. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wet, heavy snow on tree branches combined with gusty winds could result in broken tree limbs. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
